title: CS 296 Data Visualization Project 2
desc: Data visulization of the incoming student demography of UIUC. Written by JavaScript and HTML using d3.js. Incoperated a variety of web design techniques including sidebars, mouseover tip, and interactable chart.
shortDesc: CS 296, Data Visualization, SP19, in-class project

title: TET React
desc: This personal and individual project is inspiried by one of the assignment in MUS 105, which requires us to convert MIDI, frequency and musical pitch. The motivation of this project is to provide a graphical interface so that users won't need to entangle with command line tools. I choose React as the main framework to build up the front-end interface, and all the previous Python code has been reversed engineered to JavaScript to allow all the computation to be done solely on front-end.
shortDesc: Real-time MIDI number, frequency, and musical pitch converter.

title: Tone Beat Maker
desc: Another front-end application. With Tone.js with Web Audio API incorporated, this application allows user to play sound by clicking on different tiles. Customization is allowed, for each tile can be double clicked to change the pitch. Same with the TET React, both utilized the JavaScript version of the pitch-MIDI converter, which is shared in between both projects.
shortDesc: Front-end application allows user to make rudimentary sounds.

title: SoundMaker
desc: One of my colossal personal project that is still working on progress but has already shown up a great potential. This project is meant to model each part of a electronic sound, like pitch, envelop, spectrum, volume, and wave pattern, and further development including automized sound event generation and export.
shortDesc: Ongoing project. Parameterized Elektronische Musik generator.
